sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Poultry Inspection Act.

sections.heading: The Department may formulate plans and rules for the inspection,
sections.text:
culling and supervision of hatcheries and poultry flocks for the purpose of
promoting the health of poultry, increasing production, bringing about
breed improvement and classifying hatcheries and poultry flocks in
accordance with the condition thereof as ascertained by such inspection in
matters of health, standard breed characteristics and such other matters
relating thereto as the Department may prescribe.

sections.heading: As used in this Act unless the context otherwise requires:
sections.text: As used in this Act unless the context otherwise requires:

sections.heading: For the purpose of classification of hatcheries and poultry flocks
sections.text:
as authorized in Section 1 of this Act, the Department may, by rules and
regulations, adopt terminology in such regard as it may deem appropriate.

sections.heading: No hatching eggs or poultry, except poultry for immediate slaughter,
sections.text:
shall be bought, sold, transported within, or imported into the State
unless the hatchery or flock of origin is a participant in the National
Poultry and Turkey Improvement Plans for the eradication of pullorum and
fowl typhoid, or is following a program officially approved by the
Department.

sections.heading: Whenever an owner, his agent or a veterinarian has knowledge or has
sections.text:
reason to suspect that pullorum or fowl typhoid exists in a flock of
poultry or in a hatchery, he shall give notice of such fact to the
Department.

sections.heading: The Department may adopt reasonable rules and regulations consistent
sections.text: with the provisions of this Act as it may deem proper.

sections.heading: U.S.
sections.text:
Sanitation Monitored. All poultry breeding flocks and
hatcheries that produce hatching eggs, chicks or poults for table egg
production for interstate and intrastate movement must meet with U.S.
Sanitation Monitored requirements under the National Poultry Improvement
Plan. The monitoring procedure must contain a provision for table egg
production hatcheries to detect Salmonella enteritidis, serotype enteritidis.

sections.heading: Any person who falsely represents that he is subject to inspection or
sections.text:
supervision by, or has been inspected by, or is under the supervision of
the Department, or who violates any rule or regulation adopted by the
Department for administering and carrying out the provisions of this Act is
guilty of a Class B misdemeanor.
